newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 11.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 11.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Friday:
* On Thursday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 23.79 points to close at 6,540.05, on late selling in blue chips.
* The Kuala Lumpur Composite Index fell 15.89 points or 1.37 percent to 1,147.96.
* Ringgit quoted at 2.5035/45 a dollar at around 0030 GMT, stabilising after intervention by Bank Negara on Wednesday.
* Sateras Resources said it has entered into an agreement to buy the entire share capital of Fijian-incorporated timber firm Valebasoga Tropikboards Ltd for about 126 million ringgit.
* HLG Capital said it has sold its seat in the Philippine Stock Exchange to Philippine's Unicapital Securities for 74 million pesos.

* The market is expected to stay weak on Friday due to lack of buying from both retail and institutional investors. "Market sentiment is still weak. There may be some stocks picking but the overall trend will remain soft," said an institutional dealer at a bank-backed house.
